{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENT REQUESTED A DIRECT ROLLOVER OF PROCEEDS IN A 457 ACCOUNT INTO AN INHERITED IRA FOR HER BENEFIT.  CLIENT COMMUNICATED TO ME THAT IT WAS HER INTENT TO WITHDRAW A PORTION OF THESE FUNDS FOR PERSONAL USE AND THEN REDEPOSIT THE WITHDRAWN FUNDS BACK INTO THE IRA WITHIN 60 DAYS THROUGH AN INDIRECT ROLLOVER.  I CALLED THE PRODUCT SPONSOR AND CUSTODIAN ING FUNDS TWICE ON A RECORDED PHONE LINE, EXPLAINED THE REQUEST AND ASKED IF IT WAS PERMISSIBLE.  THEY INSTRUCTED ME TO INFORM THE CLIENT THAT IT WAS, WHICH I DID.  WHEN THE CLIENT ATTEMPTED TO REINVEST THE WITHDRAWAL BACK INTO THE INHERITED IRA AND WAS TOLD BY ING FUNDS THAT IT WAS NOT PERMISSIBLE, SHE REQUESTED TO BE REIMBURSED BY ING FOR HER TAX OBLIGATIONS.",
